TopicTitle: [KSP 1.4.5] [x] Science! - KSP Science report and checklist (V5.17)

Articles.Content:
If anyone needs a substitute for x science until it gets patched for 1.5.1, check out ScienceAlert by [@linuxgurugamer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129964-linuxgurugamer/)

**Edited <time datetime="2018-10-20T20:55:24Z" title="10/20/2018 08:55  PM" data-short="5 yr">October 20, 2018</time> by RedBee92**

Looks like this mod is being updated for 1.5. [https://github.com/Flupster/KSP-X-Science/releases/](https://github.com/Flupster/KSP-X-Science/releases/)

The new release is just an hour old. Should be on <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> before long I would think...

Is the Flupster version without the lag?

Dunno who Flupster is on the forum, but if it's without the lag, how about a 1.4.5 backport then?

(Just hoping, that's all)

Hey

I'm just maintaining releases until it's pushed to the main github repo located here: [https://github.com/thewebbooth/KSP-X-Science](https://github.com/thewebbooth/KSP-X-Science)

I'll keep pushing out releases until it gets merged into the main repo [https://github.com/Flupster/KSP-X-Science/releases](https://github.com/Flupster/KSP-X-Science/releases)

Finally sorry [@Gordon Dry](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/163177-gordon-dry/) all I'm doing is fixing any problems between KSP patches and the mod, I'm not developing or fixing any long term issues, I'm just making sure the mod works on the most recent version of KSP

You're totally right, my mistake. Flupster's version won't be seen by <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>. Is thewebbooth still maintaining this mod? In the meantime, I manually installed Flupster's update and it works great. Thanks!

So let me know if I'm way off base here, but I just thought I'd field the question because I'm curious... Flupster patched this mod for 1.5.1 and made a pull request to thewebbooth about a month ago but nothing has happened with it. Flupster's version works great, so if it seems like thewebbooth might not be maintaining this mod right now, is there anything we can do to make Flupster's release available to the masses? Maybe point <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> at his release for now until thewebbooth comes back to it? Or is there kind of nothing the community can do if someone stops maintaining their mod?

Alright, fair enough. I'll check back in another couple of months. In the meantime, I'm just running flupster's version. To anyone looking for this mod on 1.5.1, give his a try. Works great.

Can we hide the impossible (or at least I think impossible?) science experiments? Like "Splashed down at desert" and "Landed at water".

Also how would one go about adding mod experiments to it?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Frostiken said:
> 
> 
> Can we hide the impossible (or at least I think impossible?) science experiments? Like "Splashed down at desert" and "Landed at water".
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Also how would one go about adding mod experiments to it?
> 

There's a setting to enable or disable difficult science. Most aren't impossible, there are unique places to get things like splashed down at desert or landed at water. Other than that, in my experience it automatically finds any science available and things have to be expressly ignored to avoid things like experiments that are supposed to run over time.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-11-29T17:58:29Z" title="11/29/2018 05:58  PM" data-short="5 yr">November 29, 2018</time> by Krakatoa**

Has anyone using [X] Science! come across this error? 

    [ERR 20:56:03.860] Exception handling event onNewGameLevelLoadRequestWasSanctionedAndActioned in class ScienceChecklistAddon:System.MissingMethodException: Method not found: 'MusicLogic.SetVolume'.
      at ScienceChecklist.ScienceChecklistAddon.onLevelWasLoaded (GameScenes action) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at EventData`1[GameScenes].Fire (GameScenes data) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 

 I noticed it in my logs after starting a new Sandbox game running 1.5.1 and updating all my mods. I hadn't seen that before, but there are also a few comments on GitHub: [https://github.com/thewebbooth/KSP-X-Science/issues/28](https://github.com/thewebbooth/KSP-X-Science/issues/28)

UPDATE: I guess it helps to read all the way through the GitHub issue/comments, because I see [@Flupster](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/192673-flupster/) commented last about a compiled binary.

I've just updated my KSP 1.5.1 game to release [X]Science! v5.18.1, but am waiting for the game to load, so we'll see if that resolves this (I'm sure it will).

All are possible to archive, Waypoint Manager is a very useful tool to help, also "FieldResearch" & "AnomalySurveyor" contract packs are a great hint.  

Just FYI  it is possible to splash down at Kerbin's Highlands.

.. sadly this mod is not quite maintained anymore, nor updated to latest KSP.

I know that Landed at water is on the northern and southern ice shelves.  I landed a plane on the ice shelf after throwing Val out the back of the plane to go examine a monolith on the way.

[@Flupster](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/192673-flupster/) I only have KSP 1.5.1 so I don't know if the *official* build of this mod causes this problem, but after a few hours of uninstalling all mods then about 20 iterations of reinstalling a few, reloading, and testing, I have finally determined that your build v5.18.1 in combination of Kerbalism v2.0.0.0 causes massive stutter/hitching every few seconds while Kerbalism is transmitting science data back to <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr>. No expectation for you to fix this, but thought you might be interested.

*edit:* Did a little poking around in the source. in xScienceEventHandler it does a refresh every second whenever the players science amount changes or science is sent to <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr>. In Kerbalism, the data is transmitted constantly, so those events both fire constantly but just far enough apart so [x] is refreshing just about every second or two the entire time (could be minutes long or longer). The faster the data transmission speed (so closer to <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr>), the more pronounced it is. Changing lines 257 and 263 to use (false, 5) instead of () stops the stutter entirely during transmission, as it delays the refresh until it's all done. There's still a single stutter when [x] finally refreshes, but that's normal behavior for the mod anyhow.

I just update the mod at this point to the latest version, I don't really make any changes, but looking at the ScheduleExperimentUpdate function, this would add 5 seconds to every event, just extending it from 1s to 5s?

    		// Schedules a full experiment update in 1 second.	// In addition to the events we hook, this is also called bu the parent when	// the system has been sleeping and wakes up.  Eg when the window is made visible.	public void ScheduleExperimentUpdate( bool FullRefresh = false, int AddTime = 1 )	{		_nextExperimentUpdate = DateTime.Now.AddSeconds( AddTime );		if( FullRefresh )			_mustDoFullRefresh = true;	}

Also updated [x] Science! for 1.6 over at [https://github.com/Flupster/KSP-X-Science/releases/latest](https://github.com/Flupster/KSP-X-Science/releases/latest)
